If $ (a,b)$ and $ (c,d)$ are two points on the line whose equation is $ y=mx+k$, then the distance between $ (a,b)$ and $ (c,d)$, in terms of $ a$, $ c$, and $ m$, is\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ |a-c|\sqrt{1+m^2} \qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ |a+c|\sqrt{1+m^2} \qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ \frac{|a-c|}{\sqrt{1+m^2}} \qquad$\\
$ \textbf{(D)}\ |a-c|(1+m^2) \qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ |a-c|$ $ |m|$
